column5: fishermen we have decieded on o'sullivan's resort I did not realize it is in quebec province we are planning a trip in Ontario province the last week of may and always purchase conversation licenses for the season because we take 2 trips yearly my question is will this license apply for quebec also and are the limits the same as ontario 2 walleyes 2 northerns and 2 smallmouts and 1 lake trout ?? I searched the web but the quebec ministry is in French and I cannot read French HELP jim wolf the Chicago boys
Quebec is a different province. Your Ontario license won't work, just as your Illinois license won't work in Wisconsin.
That's the reason I run a Vermont, NY, Quebec and Ontario licenses.

Here is the web reference to Quebec's Sport Fishing Regulations in English - see http://www.mffp.gouv.qc.ca/english/p...ions/index.asp O'Sullivan Lake Lodge is located in Quebec's Zone 14. The walleye possession limit in Zone 14 is 8 walleye per legal sports fishing licence. A sports fishing licence for 7 consecutive days is 45.22 CAD or 35.92 USD at current exchange rates.
The only time an Ontario license works in Quebec is when you fish border waters like the Ottawa River or Lake Temiskaming.

fishermen thanks for all your help I actually talked to shelly the owner last night and the lodge is in Ontario (so its a mute point) but glad to have the quebec information anyway looks like they are more generous than Ontario with their limits jim wolf the Chicago boys booked the 3rd week of September 12-19 jjw the resort is almost completely booked for the summer
